main event: A pilot reported a round object leaving a long white trail near a missile pod, which he believed was a satellite or possibly a rocket.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on December 7, 1958, at 6:30 PM., The pilot noted that the object was larger than a meteor., The observation indicated the object was maneuvering, possibly vertically., Weather conditions were noted as a 'hot day', suggesting a mirage might have affected the sighting., The pilot speculated it could have been related to Sputnik 2.
sighted object: round object leaving a long white trail
witness description: a pilot who observed the object
